attributes.action: Disconnect between Immegration laws, Education Policy, Policy on Every Child Matters, Compulsary Education and Admissions Brochure for Term Time Admission and the Admissions Code of Practice as produced by the Department of Children, Schools and Families.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Policies/Laws related to the compulsory education of  every child visiting UK having  visitor entry visa for more than  three months are followed as sacrosanct by the Admission Teams at Department for Children’s Services and Life Long Learning. Whereas the immigration Department issues orders of deportation of a dependent child  on account of   getting education in a school chosen by theAdmission Teams.
This certainly violates the Human rights of a Child.(Reference Deportation of a dependent Child Arshdeep Singh by The   Home office UK Border Agency order Port Reference No. TN4/2610560 and HO Ref: IS.82.
Though the Admission Team Department for Children’s Services and Life Long Learning Hounslow Borough still confirms that “As your child had a valid visitor entry visa for two years there would not be any visa guidelines as your child is entitled to education whilst they are here and would be treated as a normal resident asking for a term-time admission.”

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with the Home Office.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
